channel.title: The Pod
channel.description: The Pod is presented The Pat McAfee Show (2.0). Pat and the supporting cast of his show come together to cut loose, break balls, and laugh at life and what's going on in the world. Kick back and have fun with us.
channel.author: The Pod
channel.itunes:author: The Pod

item.title: 235 - When the Israelites Attack BROTHER
item.description: Today’s episode of The POD kicks off with a full barn as the boys all jump right into their Halloween weekends.  As usual a run DAHN from everyone on what shows and movies they’ve been watching recently. With a rather candid start the boys then jump right into the Pod FOD which is a folder compiled of all things around the internet. Today's FOD includes a look into a couple AI figures, a pitch for Dodge Ball 2, a close call with a great white SHARK and much much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.com/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you Wednesday, Cheers.

item.title: 233 - Brucey Blue Trucks
item.description: Today's episode of The Pod opens up with the boys all catching up with an almost full barn! Mitt is back and Bruce has re-ignited the truck wars in the office with his big blue truck. The boys then dive into the pod for, which is a folder of all things compiled on the internet. Today's folder includes Author’s latest podcast, the Rings of Power, a dive in the Expendables universe and much much more. Don't forget to subscribe to the Youtube Channel, and submit your questions or comments to the Pod FOD at @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all, we'll see you Wednesday.

item.title: 232 - Welcome Back, Tone
item.description: On today’s show, the boys welcome back Tone from paternity leave as they chat about Bruce totaling his car, what life is like as a dad, and much more before they jump into a loaded POD FOD discussing Will Smith being banned from the Oscar’s for 10 years, an Italian porn star being unhappy about his upcoming Netflix series, movies and TV shows they’ve been keeping tabs on, before jumping into a couple of videos that have the internet buzzing. Be sure to follow @ThePodPMI on Instagram and Twitter to submit your submissions to the Pod FOD, and watch on youtube as we approach 100,000 followers and a massive giveaway. We appreciate you all, we’ll see you next week.

item.title: 231 - Welcome To The ThunderDome
item.description: On today's show, Pat and the boys welcome AQ Shipley to the first episode of The Pod from The ThunderDome, as they give an update on the process of getting into the new office, some of the trials and tribulations of the whole process, what they're looking forward to, what's on the horizon, and what they've been up to before jumping into a loaded POD FOD that includes a UK man getting struck by lightning while playing video games in his living room, sinkholes popping up everywhere, sanctioned boxing matches inside of telephone booths, a Chick-Fil-A worker beating the piss out of a would be carjacker, bulls bulldozing unsuspecting civilians, hackers taking over Uber and Grand Theft Auto 6, some movie and TV talk, and more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.com/ThePodPMI to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all, we'll see you next Wednesday. Cheers

item.title: 230 - Little, Little Bill
item.description:
Today’s episode of The POD kicks off with a not so full barn as all the boys catch up on their PACKED holiday weekend of NFL Football! As usual a run DAHN from everyone on what shows and movies they’ve been watching recently. With a rather candid start the boys then jump right into the Pod FOD which is a folder compiled of all things around the internet. Todays FOD includes an an RIP to the Queen (long may she reign), Mitt’s slandering of the great T-Swift, a look into Tony’s Taco Tuesdaysand much much more.

Make sure to subscribe to youtube.com/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you Wednesday, Cheers.

item.title: 223 - What Can’t Paul Walter Hauser Do?
item.description: Today’s episode of The POD kicks off with a fully STACKED ship, as Tony kicks off the show listing everyone by crew title. The boys then jump right into the pod FOD, which is a folder compiled of all things around the internet. Todays FOD includes Nicks retirement from retro-bowl, does Marvel have a vendetta against fat people, the latest updates of movie and show trailers including John Which 4, House of Dragon’s, and much much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you NEXT Wednesday, Cheers.

item.title: 222 - The Boys are Back in TAHN
item.description: Today’s episode of The POD kicks off with a half stacked barn as ALL the boys have returned from vacation with some crazy life updates and tons of great stories from the break. The boys then jump right into the pod FOD, which is a folder compiled of all things around the internet. Todays FOD includes Zitto’s re-vamped top 5 actors list, Ben and J-lo’s love getting cemented in Vegas, the latest updates of the latest and upcoming shows and movies, along with much much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you NEXT Wednesday, Cheers.

item.title: 206 - Brucey the King of the Flapjacks
item.description:
Today’s episode of The POD kicks off with a full hause of characters that get right into some HAUSE cleaning. Bruce Brahn has to come in and explain himself for consuming over one hundred pancakes in under a three week span. The boys all get into their latest shows and movies, as Mitt gives his best attempt at explaining “Euphoria”. There's also been some new gaming going on as Nick and Connor both have found themselves obsessed with their new Nientendo Switches, and ty has begun a new journey to becoming a world champion in WWE2K22. Next the boys jump right into the Pod FOD which is a folder compiled of all things from the internet. Today's FOD includes the latest news surrounding Avatar 2, Aplebees newest drive through addition, the announcement of Red Bull’s SWEET plane stunt, and much much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you Wednesday, Cheers.

item.title: 197 - THANK YEW MAGAWA
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about what they did over the weekend and Bill gives an update on his house of horrors. Today's show see's a LOADED Pod Fod that includes the boys paying homage to Magawa, the war hero mine sniffing rat who recently passed away after eight years of service, and sniffed out over 100 unexploded mines, they chat about some of the best eyebrows in the history of Russia, Gumpy explains the origin of "touque," the boys discuss some movies and TV shows they have been paying attention to, break down a Canadian man who made his wife shovel their driveway after working an overnight shift at the hospital, and much more. Don't forget to send your submissions to the Pod Fod to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram, and watch full episodes of The Pod at Youtube.com/ThePodPMI. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you next week.

item.description: Today’s episode of The POD kicks off with Ty Schmit leading the way, as the boys discuss their eventful weekend surviving a monstrous tornado. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. item.title: 184 - The Drain Flies Attack
item.description: On today's episode, the boys recollect their weekends as they celebrated both Zito and Gumpy's birthday's, and Connor tries to convince everyone that they need to watch Squid Game on Netflix. The boys then jump right into a loaded Pod FOD including a break DAHN of the “Home Alone” and “Scream” remake trailers, Tim McGraw addressing his critics head on, Connor reveals his battles at the apartment with his new worst enemy… the drain flies, what to do if a wild boar attacks you, a man doing an elbow drop onto a BMW from a the ninth floor of a building, Smash Mouth's lead singer having to retire after an unfortunate "episode," Mitt breaks down his favorite breakfast cereals, Sophia, the AI robot who wants to have a child (and eventually end the human race), and much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us, have a great weekend and we'll see you Wednesday, Cheers.

item.title: 179 - A State of The Pod Union
item.description: Today’s episode kicks off Ty Schmit welcoming the boys back from the weekend, as we are still missing our Canadian pal Gump. As we gear up for football season in the office it is with great sadness we have to announce that The Pod will now be cut DAHN to only one episode a week. The boys jump right into the Pod FOD, which is a folder compiled of all things around the internet. Today’s FOD includes a “What if” the Marvel series was casted in the ’90’s, Connor’s latest mistress, for the first time ever a live news break, and much much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you Wednesday, Cheers.

item.title: 167 - Affleck living his BEST life
item.description: Today’s episode is opened up by our Canadian pal Gumpy as he gets caught on the hot mic talking about his experience fighting against mammoth like back hair. The boys jump right into the latest updates on their show as Connor has been flying through The Supranos, finishing season 1 and letting the boys know what he’s expecting next. We then jump into the Pod FOD which is made up of all things around the internet sent in by the viewers. Today’s FoOd consists of a South side Pittsburgh fake Burger King, Jennifer Lopez and Ben Afflecks latest romances, Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis refusing to bath their children, an update on the crazy happening in New York City and much much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you Friday, Cheers.

item.title: 166 - There’s A Serial Dumper Among Us
item.description: Today’s episode of the pod kicks off feel Good Friday with all the boys catching up on their latest entertainment ventures, as Connor has finally fallen deep into The Sopranos. The boys then jump right into the Po FOD, which is made up of all things around the internet and kicks off with an apparent poop bandit running around in Tony’s neighborhood, the boys give their reactions to the latest trailers that have been released including the remake of “Dune”, reactions to the most recent big foot spotting, and much much more. The episode is wrapped up by the re-emergence of Friday bangers WWE intro addition to celebrate Pat McAfee crushing it weekly on Friday Night SmackDAHN. Thank you guys for listening and don’t forget to watch full episodes of The Pod at YouTube.com/thepodpmi and send in your submissions for the Pod FOD @ThePodPMI on twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you for rocking with us, cheers.

item.title: 165 - Space Jam 2 Might Stink………
item.description: Today’s episode is opened up by all of the boys as they all share the hosting reins for this episode.The discussion opens talking about the blockbuster hit which is the number one movie in America right now, Space Jam 2. Notorious movie lover Zito takes a surprise heal turn against the Film as Lebron and Loony Tunes fanatic Mitt, who attempts to state his case on why it does not stink. The boys then jump right into the Pod FOD which is made up of all things around the internet. Todays folder spans from a Women stealing thousands of dollars and extracting 13 teeth from a single dentist office, Jeff Bezos and a couple other rich people going into space, Mitt having to explain his tweets, reactions to the Jackass Forever trailer and much much more. Make sure to subscribe to youtube.come/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and don't forget to send your submissions for the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you rocking with us and we'll see you Friday, Cheers.

item.title: 162 - F9 "Saved Theaters"
item.description: On today's ship is sailed by the one and only Tony Digs. Tone and the boys jump right back into the F9 talk as the group is divided on if/when they will ever go to theaters and see it. After the F9 talk the boys jump right into the packed Pod FOD which is assembled from all things around the internet including the first pictures of Kurt Warner's new doc, a giant python escaping in a mall, the first ever vertically broken penis, and much more. Don't forget to subscribe to YouTube.com/thepodpmi to watch full episodes of The Pod, and send your questions to @ThePodPMI on twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all for listening, and hope you have an incredible weekend. We'll see you Wednesday.

item.title: 161 - The Boys Are Back In Town
item.description: On today's show, the guys all chat about what they did on their vacations and try not to get too distracted as they sit through a shoot out in the Euros and the beginning of "The Match" between Aaron Rodgers/Bryson Dechambeau and Tom Brady/Phil Mickelson. They also dive into a loaded Pod FOD that includes them tip-toeing around what happens in Fast 9 as not everyone has seen it yet, Adam Driver's new movie where he will make film history, robots starting to feel pain in an attempt to teach them empathy, all the different movies and TV shows that they've been watching and keep their eyes on, the appearance of goth Tony, Ben Affleck and JLo continuing their PDA run, homeless guys pooping in mop buckets on the subway, and much much more. Don't forget to subscribe to the Youtube page to watch clips and full episodes of the show, and keep sending your submissions to the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you Friday.

The guys then jump right into the Pod FOD to discuss various things including Bill's unbelievable run on American Ninja Warrior that includes footage, the cicadas still being a rather large issue around here, a woman who reportedly was pregnant with 10 kids, a homeless woman who died in Oregon before she could receive a 884 thousand dollar inheritance, Mitt explains the logistics of Tik Tok, plus much more. Be sure to subscribe to the Youtube channel in order to watch clips and full episodes of the show, and keep sending your submissions and questions to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you on Friday.

item.title: 154 - Happy Birthday McLovin
item.description: Todays episode of The Pod open up discussing the latest going on in their lives. After Connor finally finished the last episode, the boys give their full breakdown one the television show, Mayor of Easttown.They jump tight into the Pod Fod which covers an array of topics today including what "Shell" business the boys should start, The death of Chuckie Cheese, harvesting whale vomit, finish it off celebrating the birthday of Superbad persona "McLovin, and just about everything in between. Don't forget to subscribe to YouTube.com/thepodpmi to watch full episodes of The Pod, and send your questions to @ThePodPMI on twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all for listening, and hope you have an incredible weekend. We'll see you Wednesday.

item.title: 153 - The Cicadas Have Arrived
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about their Memorial Day weekends and what they did to celebrate the long weekend, Mitt describes his new bachelor pad which is essentially connected to the apartment complex's pool, they discuss the cicadas that have moved into Indiana and have taken over Zeet and Nick's neighborhood, and give their thoughts on the Friends Reunion special, plus they jump into a loaded Pod FOD that involves the best fast food burger bracket, they discuss their thoughts on The Mare of Easttown, Bill pulling a fast one and acting like he went to see F9 in theaters (it was Cruella), a woman defending her dogs from a bear, a bat causing a flight to make an emergency landing, and how everyone but Connor got verified on Twitter. Don't forget to subscribe to the Youtube channel to watch full episodes of The Pod, and send your questions to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all for listening, and hope you had an incredible Memorial Day weekend. We'll see you Friday.

item.title: 152 - Memorial Weekend
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about the latest news goin on in everyones life as the boys welcome in the summer with Memorial Day weekend. They jump right into the Pod Fod action as Fast 9 has been leaked on the internet. Gump and Digs begin their battle with Nick on why they should wait to go see it in theaters. The Fod includes teasers from the upcoming Rock movie, Ikea food court quality, gorillas daily, and much more from all things around the internet. Don't forget to subscribe to YouTube.com/thepodpmi and send your submissions for the folder @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you on Wednesday.

item.title: 149 - Shark Tank Elevator Pitches
item.description: On today's show, all the guys are back together in studio where they discuss some of the new things they've been watching on Netflix, Mitt gives an update on his apartment situation, Connor recalls how he and Zito almost died in an Uber accident in Tampa, and they get into a Pod FOD that ranges from airlines deciding to weigh passengers before letting them get on flights (to which Mitt has some despicable things to say to Zito), what animals most American's think they could kill, a convenience store robbery gone wrong, an Olympic athlete taking heat for a picture she decided to post on Instagram, and much more. Make sure to subscribe to YouTube.com/thepodpmi to watch every episode and send your submissions for the Pod Fod to @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram. Thank you all for listening, have a great weekend, we'll see you Wednesday.

item.title: 146 - How Does Death By Firing Squad Work?
item.description: On today's show, the boys get an update on Mitt being scammed by a fake landlord and losing $1,000 in the process and where he goes from here, decide whether or not Bill's truck is Mickey Mouse, and dive into a loaded Pod FOD that includes the deal movie theater concession stands are floating for the new Fast and the Furious movie that they think are going to save theaters, a young terrorist who thinks his mentor Abu Hamza is losing his fastball, the convenience store clerk who bashed a wine bottle over an angry customers head, death by fire squad being back on the docket in South Carolina, plus much more before Nick sends everyone into the weekend with a couple of fresh Friday Bangerz. Make sure you subscribe to the Youtube to watch full episodes and send your submissions into the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you all, and we'll see you on Wednesday.

item.title: 145 - Mitt Got Scammed By A Fake Landlord
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about Mitt getting catfished by a landlord and throwing $1000 down the drain on a new apartment, only to be ghosted after sending the money, plus go through all the different things they're currently watching and what they're excited for in the coming weeks. They also dive into a Pod FOD loaded with different topics including some of Hitler's reported sexual proclivities, a report that suggests men who big noses have bigger penises, what dried out stingray's look like (demons), Bill and Melinda Gates calling it quits on their marriage, the CEO of a $2 billion company getting fired for taking LSD before meetings, Tony and Bill battling for truck supremacy, Tony's new Z-Turn lawn mower, Zeet potentially getting into the riding lawn mower game, and much more. Don't forget to send your submissions into the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram to be featured on the show. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you on Friday.

item.title: 144 - Worlds Largest Duck
item.description: Todays episode of The Pod is missing the key members Ty, Connor, and Zito who are down in Florida as Pat prepares for his third week staring on Friday Night SmackDAHN. Tone, Gump, Nick, Mitt, and Mike are joined by Jason and Bill who have become regular Friday participants. As the boys are preparing for the Draft special they get right into the Fod. Today Folder consists of all things around the internet starting off with freakishly large ducks, robot dogs, the perfect poached lunch and much more. Don't forget to subscribe to the Youtube to watch full episodes of the show and submit your questions to @thepodpmi on twitter and instagram to be featured on the PodFod. We appreciate you listening, we'll see you Wednesday, cheers.

item.title: 143 - Is The New Mortal Kombat Movie Any Good: A Debate.
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about their weekends that were filled with landscaping moves, as Tony bought a new Z-Turn mower for his yard, Zito has been hiring the local football team to mow his, and Ty ran over a croquet ball with his lawn mower and is now looking for a new one. They also discuss some of the new movies and shows they've been watching before jumping into a loaded Pod FOD with topics including a pick 3 of some of the greatest action stars of all-time, a massive python that ate a woman whole in Indonesia, Anthony Mackie officially becoming a leading man by becoming the new Captain America, the new Game of Thrones series in development at HBO, and finally, the boys get into a comprehensive debate about the new Mortal Kombat movie and whether or not it was good or just entertaining, plus much more. Don't forget to subscribe to the Youtube to watch full episodes of the show and submit your questions to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram to be featured in the Pod FOD. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you on Friday.

item.title: 142 - The Bobcat Ate My Baby
item.description: Today Pod has the pleasure of being hosted by the one and only Mike Mansury. As some of the boys have taken the trip down to Tampa Florida we have Jay joining the boys again as well. The boys jump right into catching up on their lives as they discuss Billy Tubes dealing with car insurance troubles. Then jumping right into the movie discussions with Mortal Combat's new movie has released its first seven minutes, and then the boys jump right into the Fod. Today's Fod includes billboards asking to bring back tony stark, the anniversary of shrek, size of a gorillas hand, how much poop gets sprayed while flushing, and much much more from the wild internet. Make sure to got and subscribe to YouTube.com/thepodpmi and watch along with us every Wednesday and Friday.

item.title: 141 - Ronny Appleseed
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about Mansury's experience with Danny Tamberelli of Nickelodeon and Mighty Ducks fame at a Dave Matthews concert circa 2002, and jump right into the Pod FOD that includes things like the best booze to drink straight, Gumpy acting like Tom Cruise in Cocktail after hours years ago, an unusual looking plant that has been sprouting up in Madagascar and where it might have come from, a Spider-Man impersonator ruining a young kid's birthday party, video of crocodiles in the water that might shock you, people finding what is assumed to be the first mass grave for T-Rex skeletons which begs the question, was there a different Apex predator, and more. Don't forget to subscribe to Youtube.com/thepodpmi to watch full episodes and send your submissions to the Pod FOD to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you for listening, we'll see you Friday.

item.title: 140 - Jay Joins The Boys!
item.description: As some of the boys are gone on a top secret business trip, we are joined by the mystery man Jason McAfee. We jump right into it with Gump giving his glowing review of the latest episode in Big Sky, as Tony and others continue to shoot him down. Bill shows off his yinzer accent, and almost almost gets smacked in the mouth by Jay. The boys dive into The Fod which consists of all things popping across the internet like Chet Hanx music video, the latest update in the Avatar movie sequel, F9 trailer, and much more. Nick then sends the listeners into the weekend with some Bangerz. Don't forget to subscribe to our YouTube channel to watch full episodes of the Pod and follow @ThePodPMI on twitter and instagram to send in your submissions to the Pod FOD. we appreciate you all for listening and well see you on Wednesday.

item.title: 139 - Weekend At Mitt's
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about their respective weekends and Mitt waking Connor and his dog up at 4:45 in the morning on Friday night/Saturday morning after boozing with his buddies. They also chat about what shows they've been watching including the new Mighty Ducks series, the new Melissa McCarthy superhero movie, Gumpy is pumped Big Sky is returning, and whether or not Marvel fatigue is a real thing. They also get into the Pod FOD that addresses things like whether or not Connor is slowly transforming into Richard Jewell, stop lights for camels being installed in China, Gary Player's son being banned from the Masters, the new Kevin James/Sean Payton biopic that will inevitably stink, getting fired from various jobs, and how the movie theaters are once again, dead. Don't forget to subscribe to the Youtube channel to watch full episodes of the Pod and follow @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram to send in your submissions to the Pod FOD. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you on Friday.

item.title: 137 - How Many Gas Stations Are In America?
item.description: On today's show, the boys chat about Nick and Digs' respective vacations, and finally chat about Kong vs. Godzilla as more of the boys have had a chance to watch it by now. Bill also orchestrates a Pokemon card opening for perhaps the last time ever. The Pod FOD covers various subjects like the preeminent candy bracket, what actor they would each want to have the career of in the last twenty years, Mitt expands on his theory that ghosts don't haunt drunk people, and a Montana man claims his son found a bullet in a bag of Flaming Hot Cheetos, plus much more. Don't forget to subscribe to The Pod Youtube channel to watch each show, and follow @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram to send in your submissions to the Pod Fod. item.title: 136 - Should We Be Worried About Mitt?
item.description: On today's show, the boys welcome back one of the biggest dope heads around, Sales Guy Downtown BRAHN for a feel good Friday episode to send you into the weekend. Mitt is starting to worry everyone after leaving a hot dog in the air fryer for 45+ minutes and almost burning down the office, the boys give some updates on what they've been watching as of late, and answer some questions from the Pod FOD before making way for a rendition of Friday Bangerz curated by Gumpy to send you into the weekend. Don't forget to subscribe to the Youtube channel to watch full episodes, and submit your questions to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. Have a great weekend, we'll see you Wednesday.

item.title: 135 - It's Poop Again
item.description: On today's show, Tony and Nick are both out of town on vacation, so the boys just let it rip and dive into a bracket that circulated over the weekend about the best fast food restaurants you'll find with a surprising champion being crowned. They also discuss what Mitt did over the weekend, finally cleaning The Pub, Zito potentially being interested in John Wayne Gacy's house in Illinois, some new faces spot by, Foxy sticks around for a bit, and Digs checks in from a beach all boozed up on his birthday. item.title: 094 - It Takes All Of Us
item.description: On today's show, in an abundance of caution, both Tony and Nick do the show from their respective houses as they needed to get Covid tested before returning to the studio, so the boys jump right into a deep Pod FOD and discuss some of the other bad Halloween candies, whether or not water on the moon means life is sustainable there, Mitt being able to squeeze an extra 2 gallons of gas into his car, the new Assassin's Creed series coming to Netflix, which animal would be the most dangerous with the intelligence of a human, which President they'd like to have on their side in a fight to the death, they take a peek at a few videos that have been making the rounds on the internet, and Digs and Nick's pups both make an appearance! Don't forget to subscribe to youtube.com/thepatmcafeeshow to watch full episodes and everything else from PMI, and keep submitting your questions to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram to get your submission into the Pod FOD. We appreciate you all for listening, we'll see you Friday. Enjoy.

item.title: 085 - Save Gas Stations
item.description: On today's show, Tony almost gets caked, and the guys dive into what has brought about Big Motor's personality change after he attempted to body bag Foxy after the live show on Thursday. The guys also dive into a loaded Pod FOD including gas powered vehicles being a thing of the past in California as early as 2035 resulting in the guys making a desperate plea to save gas stations across the United States. They also cover how they're considering buying 15 million shares of AMC stock, Big Motor's high school football glory days, people reusing condoms in Vietnam, some tips for giving a best man speech, and much more, plus Nick selects a few more Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. Don't forget to subscribe to youtube.com/thepatmcafeeshow and become a member of the McAfee Mafia to view full episodes of The Pod on youtube, plus everything else from PMI, and continue to send in your submissions to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. We appreciate you for listening. Enjoy.

item.title: 073 - SoakGate Featuring Darius Butler

item.title: 066 - What's The Best Smell In The World?
item.description: On today's show, the guys welcome the newest employee at PMI, Mike Mansury. They learn more about his backstory, where he came from, why he wanted to come here, and what he's bringing to the table. They also discuss Tony's bachelor party weekend, whether or not there are actually birds in Italy, if The Rock has the acting range to play Willy Wonka, the news that Avatar 2 (and 3, 4, 5) are dead. They also decide what the best item to get from an ice cream truck is, what the two best smells are, and what two groups of vicious, deadly beasts they'd like protecting them if animals were coming to kill them. Plus the boys get a dynamite drop in from The Boobz Brother from Down Under. Don't forget to send in your questions or anything you want included in the Pod Fod to @ThePodPMI on Twitter/Instagram. Stay safe out there, and enjoy.

item.title: 017 - AJ Hawk Joins The Pod For A Full Tiger King Recap
item.description: On today's show, 10 year NFL veteran, Super Bowl Champion, 5th overall pick of the 2006 NFL Draft, host of the HawkCast and cohost of McAfee & Hawk Sports Talk, friend of PMI, AJ Hawk joins the boys via FaceTime. They give a full recap of everything that happened in the Netflix phenomenon "Tiger King" and give their thoughts, reactions, and also try to cast the eventual biopic that we hope will be coming out soon. The guys also recap the Sweet Sixteen of March Sadness and look ahead to the Elite 8 where America's Sweetheart, SDDEO (she doesn't dump em out) looks to continue its storybook run to a national title. Today's a fun one. Stay safe this weekend, and enjoy.

item.title: 010 - The Pod Investigates Dinky One
item.description: On today's show, the boys air out of a few grievances that they've seen popping up on the internet, dive into the center of what potentially started the Coronavirus, and discuss how the office has turned into a level of toxicity that no one expected. The guys also hand out their stooges and sellaht's of the week, investigate a new dating app that encourages men with small penises to join, and gear up for another round of Digs Debates which include arguments about who is better, Chuck Norris or Jackie Chan, or would you rather be stranded in the ocean or space with 10 days of supplies and rations. Today was a fun one. Enjoy.

item.title: 009 - The Canadian Diplomat
item.description: On today's show, the guys welcome back our Canadian pal, Gump. The boys fire several questions at Gump about the differences between Canada and the United States and are surprised by several of his answers. The guys also discuss how the wave is dead and Foxy defends doing it at sporting events, they answer questions from The People of The Pod, react to some videos that made headlines this weekend, Pat recounts a recent run-in with what he thought was a home intruder, and the members of The Pub recount a very creepy experience when they recently went looking for a new house. Today is a fun one. Enjoy.

item.title: 008 - The Pod Vs. Nik Wallenda
item.description: On today’s episode of The Pod, the guys do a deep dive into Nik Wallenda’s volcano walk and none of them are too happy about the results, so they give a couple of ideas to make his next stunt a lot more entertaining. The guys also chat more about the Coronavirus and try to decide whether or not they are in harm’s way and try to figure out what Coronavirus porn is. The boys also discuss the students at Princeton whining that Marshawn Lynch will speak at their graduation which spills into a conversation about how the TikTok generation is the worst. The guys also pay homage to the victims of the Boston Massacre, chat about Foxy, Zito, and Connor looking for a new place to live, give a few picks for Check It Aht, and they receive a call from a special guest. It’s a free flowing, feel good Friday of sorts. Enjoy.

item.title: 007 - Tony Battles CTE Brain
item.description: On today's episode of The Pod, Digs masterfully works his way through a bout of CTE brain that was brought on by his new workout schedule. The guys listen to an absolute banger of a submission for theme song to the show, hand out their Stooge/Sellaht of the week which includes a local weatherman taking an interesting approach to a woman grieving, the guy drinking out of the soup ladle at a supermarket, LaVar Ball, and the prince that is trying to swindle Zeet for 100k. The guys also dive into another round of Digs Debates, answer questions from The People of The Pod, and get into a lot more nonsense along the way. Enjoy.

item.title: 006 - Former #2 Overall Pick Of The 1998 NFL Draft Ryan Leaf & Stand-Up Comedian Al Jackson Join The Pod
item.description: On today's show, the guys are joined by former #2 pick of the San Diego Chargers and former Quarterback of the Chargers, Cowboys, Buccaneers, and Seahawks, a man who has turned his life around and is now thriving, Ryan Leaf. Also joining the guys is one of the cohosts of The Daily Blast Live, stand-up comedian and friend of the office, Al Jackson. Ryan, Al and the guys dive into just about everything imaginable ranging from Ryan's struggle and eventual resurgence, the differences between the way booze and drugs are accepted, what the best pizza chain is, an update on the Coronavirus, what TV shows everyone is most embarrassed to watch are, and Al finishes things off with a hilarious story about his Instagram handle. Strap in, this is a fun one. Enjoy.

item.title: 002 - Episode Two Featuring Skinny Legs McGee
item.description: On today’s episode of The Pod, Digs continues to reluctantly accept his role as the host of the show, the guys reminisce about a road trip to Pittsburgh that comes back to one memory, and they introduce a few new segments. On this week’s “Sh*t I’ve Seen on the Internet” the guys discuss a tweet going around that asks what movie traumatizes you as a kid and the guys have some interesting answers. They also try to choose what fruit or vegetable is the easiest to throw the farthest distance, decide whether or not tomfoolery was involved in making Foxy’s legs look like toothpicks in a green screen photo, cover news you need to know with Nick, and give some movie/TV show picks in the new segment Check it AHT or Don’t check it AHT. Don’t forget that St. Paddy’s day merch is now available on patmcafeeshow.com, and we’re opening the search for a new original theme/intro so DM submissions to @ThePodPMI on Twitter and Instagram. Enjoy the show, and have a great weekend.

item.title: 001 - The Inaugural Episode featuring Super Bowl Champion Gary Brackett
item.description: Today is the debut episode of The Pod, a show about nothing with all the familiar faces from Pat McAfee Inc.. On today’s show Pat, Digs, Nick Ty, Zito, Connor, and Foxy welcome in Super Bowl Champion, Restaurant owner, businessman, and all around great guy, Gary Brackett. The guys split into two teams and get into some heated debates, converse about the greatness of Toradol, each of the guys give their Stooge or Sellaht of the week, Digs gives his favorite history fact of the day, and they get to know Gary Brackett on a more personal level on the inaugural episode of The Pod. Rate, review, and subscribe to the show and send any video questions you have to be featured on the show @ThePodPMI. Welcome to the family, and enjoy the show.

item.title: Ep 143 - Swan Song
item.description: On today's show, Todd has some news to share with the guys about his new cop podcast that he has been putting a lot of time into, and some of his plans for his standup comedy over the coming weeks. The guys also discuss a scientist electing to have brain surgery in order to try and cure his alcoholism, and whether or not the surgery got the job done, and Digs and Zito get into a few more battles of wits. The guys also discuss their favorite Super Bowl commercials, chat about the new HBO documentary series McMillion$, dealing with the McDonald's Monopoly scandal, they get into some Steven Seagal related Fact or Fiction, talk about their healthy eating habits as of late, and cover everything else they can think of, plus Pat stops by to get an update on everything and check in with everybody. It's a hilarious episode that none of us will forget. Come and have a good time with us.

item.title: Ep 138 - Voice-Overs & Subtitles
item.description: Imagine a world where all movies contain voice-overs or subtitles. Scary isn’t it? Well, we might soon find ourselves living in a world where this is no longer the exception, but the rule. In this episode, boys provide scientific proof to support this theory. They also talk about Space Force uniforms, billionaires on the moon, celebrity dog poop and movies that make them cry. This is a very special episode. Enjoy.

item.title: Ep 137 - Rory Scovel / Crazy Talk
item.description:
In the last 45 minutes of this episode, the boys get loose as hell. Probably the craziest convo they’ve ever had. But before that, they spend 25 minutes having a convo with an incredible dude and comedian that Todd’s been wanting to talk to for some time.

The boys interviewed stand-up comedian and actor, Rory Scovel. Rory currently co-hosts The Pen Pals Podcast, he has two stand-up specials on Netflix. Outside of stand-up comedy, Scovel is known for acting in the TruTV show Those Who Can't and in the 2018 movie I Feel Pretty with Amy Schumer, as well as being a writer for The Eric Andre Show.

Rory is currently on the Comedians Following Tool Tour with fellow comedians Nick Youssef and Freddy Scott. The tour has them actually following the band Tool and performing comedy shows the night before each Tool concert. Tickets and show information are available at http://www.nottoolband.com/

The boys interviewed stand-up comedian and actor, Rory Scovel. Rory currently co-hosts The Pen Pals Podcast, he has two stand-up specials on Netflix. Outside of stand-up comedy, Scovel is known for acting in the TruTV show Those Who Can't and in the 2018 movie I Feel Pretty with Amy Schumer, as well as being a writer for The Eric Andre Show.

Rory is currently on the Comedians Following Tool Tour with fellow comedians Nick Youssef and Freddy Scott. The tour has them actually following the band Tool and performing comedy shows the night before each Tool concert. Tickets and show information are available at http://www.nottoolband.com/

item.title: Ep 136 - An Aussie Legend
item.description:
In this episode the boys shoot the shit a bit about what’s going on at PMI and the rest of the world then they have an incredible conversation with an incredible man. An Aussie legend, Paul De Gelder. Paul is a retired clearance diver for the Royal Australian Navy who survived a violent attack from a 9 foot bull shark during an operational dive. He ultimately lost a hand and a leg as a result of the attack but managed to escape and swim to safety.

Today Paul De Gelder remains an elite member of the diving community by serving as the brand ambassador for Indigo Industries, a cutting-edge scuba diving equipment manufacturer. Paul is also a motivational speaker and the author of No Time for Fear: How a Shark Attack Survivor Beat the Odds.

For more information on Paul De Gelder and for links to purchase his book, please visit http://pauldegelder.com/

item.title: Ep 129 - Dancing With The Devil
item.description:
This episode features an incredible interview with retired DEA agent Louis “Lou” Diaz. Lou spent 22 of his 28 years in the DEA working undercover. In that time he was largely responsible for the arrest and conviction of Nicky Barnes who was an African-American crime boss that controlled the heroin trade in the 1970’s. Nicky Barnes was portrayed by Cuba Gooding Jr. in the movie American Gangster. Lou sets the story straight about that movie and it’s portrayal of Nicky Barnes and Frank Lucas. He also, talks about other investigations he worked and about life growing up in a neighborhood that left him two career options...become a gangster or a cop.

Lou Diaz is also the author of Dancing with the Devil: Confessions of an Undercover Agent, which is available on Amazon.

item.title: Ep 124 - FBI Profiler Candice DeLong
item.description:
The boys talk about how each spent their Thanksgiving holiday and then they have a chat with retired FBI Criminal Profiler Candice DeLong.

Candice is the author of Special Agent: My Life on the Front Lines as a Woman in the FBI and talks about her time spent on the Unabomber investigation as well as her thoughts on the Lacy Peterson, Casey Anthony and Jon Brent Ramsey investigations.

Candice is the host of Deadly Women and  Facing Evil on Investigation Discovery. Watch those shows and check out her book at

https://www.amazon.com/Special-Agent-Front-Lines-Woman/dp/0786867078

item.title: Ep 122 - Chatting With Bob Saget
item.description:
We got the chance to speak with legend of stage and screen, Bob Saget. Bob played Danny Tanner on the ABC sitcom Full House and its Netflix sequel Fuller House, he was the host of America's Funniest Home Videos for 8 seasons, he’s been crushing the standup comedy game for 4 decades and now he’s the host of Nashville Squares on CMT.

We fell in love with Bob immediately. He was so friendly and accommodating and you can tell that he knows no stranger, which is such a rare quality for a person as famous as he is. We took full advantage of his generosity and spoke with him for over 50 minutes. We enjoyed every second of it and we think you will too.

Catch Bob on CMT's Nashville Squares Friday nights at 8pm ET / 7pm CT.

item.title: Ep 121 - The Voice Of Culpable
item.description:
In today’s episode, Todd takes a deep dive into Season 1 of the hit, true-crime podcast Culpable with the host of Culpable, Dennis Cooper. Season 1 tells the story of the suspicious death of Christian Andreacchio of Meridian, MS, the controversial death investigation that was ruled a suicide and Christian’s mother’s uphill battle to get the case re-opened and investigated as a homicide.

As you’ll learn in this episode, Dennis, who is also the founder of Black Mountain Media, and his team not only do a brilliant job of telling this compelling story but they also, with the help of a team of private investigators, cast even more doubt on the integrity of the police investigation and the coroner’s ruling. It’s a story we felt compelled to share and we’re grateful to Dennis for coming on the show to do so.

You can listen to Culpable anywhere you listen to podcasts. You can follow them at @culpablepodcast on Twitter and Instagram and you can visit their website at culpablepodcast.com.

Black Mountain Media is offering a $100,000 reward to anyone who provides information that helps solve this case. You can submit a tip by emailing them at tips@blackmountainmedia.net or leave a message at (470) 300-4915.

We take care of each other. It’s what we do.

item.title: Ep 119 - The Guys Who Got Escobar
item.description:
This episode features an interview with retired DEA agents Steve Murphy & Javier Pena. Murphy & Pena are the agents who brought down Pablo Escobar. Their story inspired the hit Netflix series Narcos. As you'll hear in this interview, there are some differences between what really happened and what was portrayed in the series. This is one of our favorite interviews thus far so we hope you enjoy it.

If you'd like to learn more about the investigation that ended the reign of Pablo Escobar you can get Steve and Javier's new book Manhunters: How We Took Down Pablo Escobar at www.deanarcos.com. If you purchase the book from their website, Steve and Javier will personalize and sign your copy.

item.title: Ep 113 - Jay Dobyns Mayor of Copland
item.description:
Episode Description:

This episode features an interview with a true American badass, a hero, and a legend in the undercover world of law enforcement. Jay Dobyns is a retired ATF agent who was the first undercover federal agent to successfully infiltrate and actually become a patch-wearing member of the Hells Angels. This interview is just over an hour long and it's incredible. We hope you enjoy listening to it half as much as we did recording it.

Want more Jay Dobyns?

Jay is also a New York Times and an International Best Selling author. You can find his books No Angel: My Harrowing Undercover Journey to the Inner Circle of the Hells Angelsand Catching Hell: A True Story of Abandonment and Betrayaleverywhere books can be found or at jaydobyns.com.

Make sure you check out Jay's podcast Copland to hear Jay interview other Law Enforcement legends as the tell amazing stories from their career. If you're like us, you can't get enough Jay Dobyns.

item.title: Ep 109 - Our Friend Gary Gulman
item.description:
Gary had a weekly segment on Heartland Radio for quite some time where he’d test new material out on us and the listeners but we’ve never really had the chance to interview him in depth. So, after the release of his new comedy special “The Great Depresh” released on HBO this past weekend Gary was nice enough to give us the opportunity. (7:35 - 44:13)

This is a 40 minute interview that dives deep. It dives deep into Gary’s life-long struggle with depression. It dives deep into how he almost lost that struggle. It dives deep into how he was able to not only get healthy enough to leave in-patient treatment, but how he got healthy enough to resume his standup career and build a special that tells the story of his victory over this horrible disease. Oh, and Judd Apatow produced it. No big deal.

item.title: Ep. 106 - Our Pal Dan Cummins
item.description: Our friend and most requested guest to have back on the show, Dan Cummins was our guest for this episode. The greatest thing about Dan is he just loves shooting the shit and letting it rip and that's what this podcast is all about. If you're not familiar with Dan Cummins, he's an incredibly talented standup comedian who's appeared on Comedy Central, Conan, The Tonight Show and The Late Late Show. He's best known for his hit podcast "Timesuck" where Dan dives deep into serial killers, cults, conspiracies, history, and the paranormal in a way that's both educational and hysterical. He also just launched a new podcast called "Scared to Death" where Dan terrifies his wife with alleged-to-be-true horror stories about Demonic possession, poltergeists, shadow people and more. See why we love him?

item.itunes:summary: Our friend and most requested guest to have back on the show, Dan Cummins was our guest for this episode. The greatest thing about Dan is he just loves shooting the shit and letting it rip and that's what this podcast is all about. If you're not familiar with Dan Cummins, he's an incredibly talented standup comedian who's appeared on Comedy Central, Conan, The Tonight Show and The Late Late Show. He's best known for his hit podcast "Timesuck" where Dan dives deep into serial killers, cults, conspiracies, history, and the paranormal in a way that's both educational and hysterical. He also just launched a new podcast called "Scared to Death" where Dan terrifies his wife with alleged-to-be-true horror stories about Demonic possession, poltergeists, shadow people and more. See why we love him?

item.title: Ep. 105 - Our First FCC Violation
item.description: The boys had a lot to talk about today. Digs got The Pat McAfee Show in trouble for saying “shitty” on the radio, Ty is learning how to live without sleep, Pat is getting used to having so many different hats to wear now (Sports Radio Talk Show Host, WWE personality, College Football Analyst, ESPN panelist for Get Up and every other show when they need him and of course, small business owner.) Its quite a conversation. Enjoy.

item.title: Ep. 94 - Ice Ice Baby
item.description:
Pat was out of town for meetings pertaining to his new booth gig with ESPN's Thursday Night College Football, so the boys held it down in his absence. They kicked things off with a phone call to comedian Rich Ragains and then debated the tough topics that other podcasts are afraid to touch. Topics like crushed ice cubes vs, whole cubes, frozen margs vs on-the-rocks, bone-in wings vs boneless, and right side vs left side of the bed. They also played Fact or Fiction and answered 3 outstanding listener questions.

item.title: Ep. 87 - Animal War
item.description:
Todd, Digs, Nick, Ty, Gumpy, Zito and Bailey recorded this vacation episode because they didn't want to spend the effort it takes to mix together a Best-Of. So, they cam into the studio and discussed climate change, how animals are plotting to take over the planet, the power of grapefruit, the latest innovations from GoPro, twins in prison, Ben Afleck and a lot of Russell Crowe. They did a new Fact or Fiction segment, brought back I Wanna Know and ended with Friday Bangerz.  We hope you had a great 4th of July.

item.title: Ep. 84 - Office Softball Team
item.description:
The boys really went hard on this one. They recapped some hilarious behind the scene moments from the comedy tour and then dove right into world issues like dehydration, couch sleep, public restrooms, bad shoe stores, cheating on tests in college and high school, counterfeit money, the life of a PGA professional, and get into a lengthy discuss about adults who take softball leagues too seriously, as well as construct their lineup for a potential PMI company softball team. Come have a good time with us!

item.itunes:summary:
On today's show, our Canadian brother Gumpy joins the boys in studio.  They talk about the Pat McAfee Does America this weekend as well as the hazards of club sandwiches, sleeping dogs, RV rentals, angry methed out squirrels, whether or not putting butter in your coffee is an acceptable move, grilling, the different sizes of drones the US has in their fleet, some of the many differences between the United States and Canada, convenience stores, Mussolini and per usual, they help send you into the weekend with another edition of Friday Bangerz.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @GumpSox10

item.title: Ep. 82 - Horror Stories
item.description:
On today's show, the guys play a couple of social media word games that have been going viral on Twitter, they talk about the war the USGA has waged against Pat and how he will not go quietly into the night when it comes to fighting this atrocity. Zito also attempts to spell coup (with poor results), they catch up with what's happening in the world including Babe Ruth's jersey being sold at auction for over $5 million, they discuss Jim Kong's latest execution techniques, the escape artist/magician from India that isn't good at his job, storm chasin' season, the big fuss around rage rooms, they discuss the Pat McAfee Does America Tour, and much, much more. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.


Episode Sponsors and Discounts:

SeatGeek - download the SeatGeek app and enter the promo code HEARTLAND for $10 off your first SeatGeek purchase.

ShadyRays - go to ShadyRays.com and use the code HEARTLAND25 for 25% off ONE PAIR of sunglasses from the shade shop.

Rhone - go to Rhone.com/HEARTLAND and use promo code HEARTLAND to get 20% off your first purchase.

item.title: Ep. 81 - Al Jackson
item.description:
On today's show, hilarious friend of the show @aljackson, sits in on the episode so people can learn why we love him so much.  Al co-hosts The Daily Blast Live as well as the weekly podcast "Al & Frank Try To Be Serious" with Frank Caliendo.  The boys took an 80 minute look into Al's life as he shared some incredible stories from standup comedy, acting, and his world away from stage and screen. As always, the guys each pick a song for Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. It's a good one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeshow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @aljackson

item.title: Ep. 80 - Reach For The Sun
item.description:
Today the boys do their best to make sense of the world by discussing the wonders of religion, Zito's back pain, whether or not Todd has a realistic chance in a fight with Steven Seagal, the Women's World Cup and how the United States National Team might be the greatest soccer team ever assembled, the tracball craze that has been taking over the office, cigars, frisbee golf, sobriety, Pat's experiences playing locker room corn hole, darts, cocaine, the Black Crows, and KFC. They also cover the unfortunate circumstances surrounding how the California wild fires started, helicopter rescues, play another round of Fact or Fiction, and close out the show with each member of the crew giving their best advice in just 4 words. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.

item.title: Ep. 79 - Ryan Niemiller From America's Got Talent
item.description:
On today's show, comedian Ryan Niemiller visits with the boys in the studio for the entire episode. Ryan took the world by storm with his incredible performance on America's Got Talent on Tuesday night (June 4th), earning a unanimous yes from the judges to put him through to the next round. He talks about his experience thus far on AGT and how his life has changed as of a result of 10,000,000 people seeing his act. He also shares some insights about what it was like to grow up with a disability and how it shaped him into the person and comedian that he is today. It's a great conversation with lots of laughs throughout covering a range of different topics. As always, the guys end the episode with some Friday Bangerz to help propel you into the weekend. Make sure to follow Ryan on social media @cripplethreat8 and use #ClubNubb when posting or tweeting about him. Let's help him win the whole damn thing. You don't want to miss this one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @cripplethreat8.


Episode Sponsors and Discounts:

23&Me - get 50% off 23andMe's Health + Ancestry Kit by visiting 23andme.com/HEARTLAND.  This makes the perfect Father's Day Gift.  Offer ends June 17th.  

Postmates - our listeners get $100 of free delivery credit for your first 7 days when you download the Postmates app and use the promo code HEARTLAND.

Indochino - get any premium Indochino suit for just $359 at Indochino.com when you enter the promo code HEARTLAND at checkout.

item.title: Ep. 78 - Sex Acronyms
item.description:
The boys had a blast this episode as they discuss what exactly panda's diets consist of, the creation of gun powder, Bigfoot, the Netflix original show Wild China, egg rolls, sandwiches, how certain generations are ruining doorbell culture, trash dumpsters, the end of the world, whether or not sex scenes are necessary in films these days, Amy Schumer and John Cena's sex scene in "Trainwreck," and the etiquette around picking up hitchhikers. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.

item.title: Ep. 77 - Sushi Monkeys
item.description:
On today's show, the boys try to solve many of the world’s problems as they tackle subjects such as finding the perfect recliner, drool stains, dry cleaners, ironing, boot camp for kids, whether or not the Raiders are going to be good this year, Skyline Chili, Hibachi Grills, sushi, UFO’s, The new Rambo trailer, Top Gun, Steven Spielberg's net worth, and a couple Jeopardy questions in honor of Pat's recent interview with Jeopardy James Holzhauer. Per usual, the guys each send in a song for Friday Bangerz to try and help launch you into the weekend. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us!

item.title: Ep. 76 - IndyCar Driver Conor Daly & Comedian Rich Ragains
item.description:
Today's episode features two great guests. They kick things off with friend of the show, IndyCar driver Conor Daly, who just finished 10th in this year's 103rd running of the Indianapolis 500. Conor explains to the boys what happened during the confusing restart with 17 laps remaining and how it effected his fight for position and catches them up on his life. Also joining the show is Rich Ragains, a standup comedian based out of Louisville, KY.  He's one of Todd's best friends in comedy and happened to be passing through Indianapolis so he stopped in the studio to have a chat and introduce himself to the Heartland Radio family. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @ConorDaly22, and @richragains.

 

Episode Sponsors and Discounts:

SeatGeek - download the app and use the promo code HEARTLAND for $10 off your first purchase.

MVMT Sunglasses - go to MVMT.com/HEARTLAND and get 15% off with FREE SHIPPING and FREE RETURNS

Dave app - the app that helps you avoid overdraft fees forever!  Go to Dave.com/HEARTLAND to download the app so they know we sent you!

Omaha Steaks - go to OmahaSteaks.com and enter the promo code HEARTLAND in the search bar for 74% off the Father's Day Steak Fix gift package.  A $235 value for only $59.99.

item.title: Ep. 75 - Ocean Poop
item.description:
This episode features a very cool conversation with musician and friend of the show Clayton Anderson.  Clayton and the boys discuss the country music industry, his personal battles with chasing success and how he overcame thoughts of giving up and regained his passion (0:00-49:44). After the interview the crew has a hilarious conversation about some world events and everyone gets to know Digs a letter better than they did before and we're not sure that's a good thing, and as always the guys each pick a song for Friday Bangerz to help send you into your Memorial Day weekend. Come have a good time with us, and enjoy Memorial Day.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy


Here's a tip for for today's episode - DON"T SKIP THE AD READS!  Each one is a heater.

item.title: Ep. 74 - Asian Words
item.description:
Dare we say this is one of the most fun episodes the boys have ever recorded?  Yeah, we dare.  In hilarious fashion, the crew covers a litany of topics including bootleg movies, cocaine, heroin, crack, meth, smoke breaks, bird attacks, Chinese buffets, fortune cookies, Toradol, drive-thru windows, motorcycles, washing your feet in the shower, hangover I.V.'s, TSA pre-check, loose change, sex tapes, evil lunch ladies, parking tickets, seat belts, and window breaking tools. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.

item.description:

item.title: Ep. 72 - Robert Kelly
item.description:

This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @robertkelly.

item.title: Ep. 71 - Margaret Cho
item.description:
On today's show, standup comedy legend, Margaret Cho, joins the crew live in studio for 30 minutes of pure hilarity. She gives her thoughts on Robert Kraft, what it was like working with Will Smith on "Bright," her thoughts on Nicolas Cage from their time on set together while filming "Face/Off," and gives a little sneak peek of her set (3:27-35:28). The guys also cover the potential Cartel tunnel system from LA to Mexico, Gorms tells a few stories about his time working at the popular nightclub, Tatou, in Los Angeles, dive into what they think the witness protection system is like for famous people, and Pat gives a documentary recommendation as the guys discuss "Operation Odessa," dealing with a man trying to sell a Cold War era Soviet submarine to the Cartel in order to smuggle drugs into the United States. The guys also discuss their preference on binging TV shows as opposed to watching them every week, and they look ahead to the final two Game of Thrones episodes. As always, the guys close out the show with another edition of Friday Bangerz to help propel you into the weekend. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @baileymccomas

item.title: Ep. 70 - Sperm Donors
item.description:
On today's show, the guys sit down and have a glorious conversation about Gorman's dilemma on donating sperm to his friends and how he almost became Carson Daly before there was a Carson Daly.  They also cover a variety of other topics, including Chance the Rapper bringing back Wendy's spicy nuggets, the fall of the $5 footlong, whether or not the chicken from Los Pollos Hermanos in Breaking Bad is any good. The guys also dive into the Bubonic Plague making a triumphant return to Mongolia due to people eating massive rats, a rather large measles outbreak in Pennsylvania, booger sugar, everybody's thoughts on the Zac Efron Ted Bundy Netflix movie, Foxy's abnormal fondness for vanilla ice cream, the HBO mini-series Chernobyl, John Wick, the Starbucks Game of Thrones incident, endangered species, bed time rituals and Todd tries to catch everyone on their toes with another edition of Fact or Fiction. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.

item.title: Ep. 69 - Omaha Beach
item.description:
On today's show, the guys debate some of the biggest issues facing us today while Pat is in an incredibly important meeting. They cover whether or not the Wendy's Cookie Dough Frosty is a game changer and the pecking order of Little Debby Snack's. They also dive into some Derby chat and give out their favorites (one of which has already been scratched), and resident olds, Todd and Gorms, walk the rest of the crew through a list of their mom's go-to dishes that have gone extinct.  The guys also discuss the list of "Top Ten Most Obscure College Degrees" offered today, the possible existence of the abominable snowman in Nepal, the world's worst son, computer mishaps at the Geek Squad, they bring back a great question for I Wanna Know, answer a few listener questions, and of course, help propel you into the weekend with another edition of Friday Bangerz. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @evanfoxy, and @baileymccomas.

item.title: Ep. 68 - The Penitentiary Pen Pal Draft
item.description:
On today's show, the guys hold the first ever penitentiary pen pal draft. The rules are simple; each participant selects two people currently in prison to write letters to and the first person who successfully receives two correspondences wins, and some of the picks will definitely surprise you. The guys also cover Jock Jams and uncover the truth about Gary Glitter, waiting until the last minute to plan Pat's charity golf outing (which is tomorrow), talk about the release of today's new OCW (Mexican Celebration), talk about the white kid who smashed the amateur 100m dash record, which snowballs into a conversation about Oscar Pistorius, try to decide what is the appropriate amount of time before people can start discussing spoilers from Avengers: End Game without having to worry about someone knocking your teeth out, and Gorms checks in on an Italian man from Pennsylvania who had a rough time accepting a break up. Today's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @baileymccomas

item.title: Ep. 66 - A Convo With Two American Badasses
item.description: On today’s show, the guys have the honor of sitting down with two true American heroes, Scott Neil and Bob Pennington, the real-life Green Berets portrayed in the movie, “12 Strong,” starring Chris Hemsworth and Michael Shannon. They have an incredible conversation and give an inside look into a part of our world that we rarely get to hear. They also chat about their current plans, including getting into the alcohol business with Horse Soldier Bourbon from American Freedom Distillery (https://www.americanfreedomdistillery.com/). To close out the show, the guys choose a few patriotic bangers to help send you into the weekend. Don’t miss this one, it’s incredible.

item.title: Ep. 65 - Straight To Hell
item.description:
On today's episode, the guys dive headfirst into quite a bit of movie talk as they discuss some of the films they're looking forward to seeing the most in the next few months (Avengers: End Game, Godzilla, Lion King, among others),chat a little bit about "The Mule," and discuss how depressing it is to see Clint Eastwood getting as old as he is. They also discuss Will Smith's latest film, "Gemini Man," and as expected, Nick isn't too thrilled about it. Todd also brings back an actor/director version of fact or fiction, and the guys preview today's release of OCW: Straight to Hell. Later, the full crew comes into the study to discuss the Office Championship Wrestling event minutes after they finished filming. Make sure you check out OCW: Straight to Hell today at noonish on all of the Pat McAfee Inc. social media channels. This is a fun one. Come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @baileymccomas.

item.title: Ep. 64 - Office Championship Wrestling
item.description:
On today's show, the guys cover a wide range of topics including the newest Jeopardy! champion who is making waves across the game show world right now which spins into what game show each of the guys would be the best at, they cover the American Pickers, Pawn Stars, Pat's Bentley that won't start, garage sales, the first ever Lou Holtz-off, Todd's white tile floors, Gorms' love for garage sales, Jason Momoa's beard, dirty phones, the death of the iPad, and the best fast food burgers. The guys also develop a new idea around becoming prison pen pals with some of the most famous celebrities in jail right now, the birth of OFFICE CHAMPIONSHIP WRESTLING (coming soon) and per usual, the guys each pick a song to help send you into the weekend on this week's edition of Friday Bangerz.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.

item.title: Ep. 63 - Piss Limbo Kids
item.description:
On today's show, the boys talk about Garth Brooks, the Norte Dame fire and what each of the guys would save from respective homes if they were to light on fire, dumb games we used to play when we were young, Russell Wilson being one of the most insufferable humans on the planet, the absence of LeBron James diminishing the play of the NBA playoffs, too much NBA, dumb lawsuits, old porn vs new porn, blindness vs deafness, earthquakes, tornados, and they try to help Todd out with an issue he’s having at home.  Enjoy this one.  We sure did.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @baileymccomas, and ends with a banger from the one and only, Garth Brooks.

item.title: Ep. 62 - NCIS Indianapolis
item.description:
On today's show, the guys let loose on a plethora of topics including but not limited to; the time Todd almost solved a cold case murder from Hawaii, Kim Kardashian's law degree, old people driving, PETA, National Pet Day, mansions in Virginia, The Pub's current mouse infestation problem, Todd's dog, Fat Jimmy, killing a rabbit, what they all think of the new Lion King trailer and whether or not Pat should see the original before the new one comes out, and some run-in's they've had with home security. Per usual, the guys each send in a song to help propel you into the weekend with another edition of Friday Bangerz. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.

item.title: Ep. 61 - The Roadhawks Are Back
item.description:
Pat and The Roadhawks (Ty, Evan, Nick, Connor and Zito) are back from their travels on The Road To Wrestlemania so this episode has the full PMI crew.  The boys recap Pat's unforgettable appearance on ESPN's "Get Up" with Mike Greenberg, Jalen Rose, Marcus Spears, and Isiah Thomas, and  also give a quick recap of what is now being dubbed "The Massacre at Metlife," as The Pub comes up with a couple of ways to try and raise the money for outstanding fines that Zito owes to PMI. They also chat about Digs becoming a responsible adult with the birth of Tony Landscapes, Koi ponds, drunk hillbillies, ivory poachers, and dive a little bit into who each of their picks are for the Game Of Thrones deadpool. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us. 


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy.

item.title: Ep. 60 - Favorite Child
item.description:
On today’s show, Todd, Digs, Gorms, and Bailey are holding in down in Indianapolis while the rest of the guys are still on the road in Brooklyn for NXT Takeover and then Wrestlemania. The guys cover whether or not any of them want any kids, and if they know whether or not they are their parents favorite child. Todd and Digs also talk about life at their homes with their dogs, Gorms wonders why Aaron Judge is playing for peanuts for the Yankees, they cover the worst parents in America, including a dad who stole his daughter’s Girl Scout cookie haul. They also talk about Jeff Bezos’ wife becoming one of the richest people in the world and what their first purchase would be if they were to get that type of settlement, and Todd brings back a little Jeff Bezos related Fact or Fiction. As always, the guys all send in some songs to help send you into the weekend the right way with some Friday Bangerz.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @Digz, @HeyGorman, and @baileymccomas.

item.title: Ep. 59 - Moon Poop Monsters
item.description: Todd, Digs, Gorman and Gator hold down the fort while Pat and the #RoadHawks continue their travels on The Road To Wrestlemania.  They kick things off with a call-in from friend of the show @garygulman who explains why he thinks this younger generation is getting a bad rep for being soft.  The boys also discuss generational differences among the group as they point out things they each miss from the past as well as things they were glad to see go.  They cover climate change, global warming, life on the moon, the zika virus, Canadian border crossings and they close things out with a couple listener questions.  Enjoy.

item.title: Ep. 58 - We Got A Rat
item.description:
On today's show, the guys discuss Colombo mob boss, Sonny Franzese's son, John, who was recently outed by an Indianapolis newspaper with his daily routine and locations published, and try to decide if he's a rat or not and whether they all would flip on their dads if necessary. The guys also cover two elephants dying at the Indianapolis Zoo which spawns a conversation about what type of zoo animal each of the guys would choose as a pet. Also included are conversations about a man in Canada taking it upon himself to fill in potholes and being paid with weed and whether or not any of the guys would consider doing something like that in Indianapolis, a heated debate regarding if George Clooney is overrated or not, some movie talk, and as always, the guys each pick a couple of songs for Friday Bangerz to help catapult you into the weekend. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, @evanfoxy, and @baileymccomas

item.title: Ep. 57 - Monkey Business
item.description:
On today's show, the guys discuss whether or not having a pet monkey/orangutan is a good idea and what some of the benefits would be. They also discuss their respective dogs and how it feels similar to being a parent, and Gorman tells the legend of his former dog, Norman Gorman. The guys also discuss Pat's name climbing back up the odds ladder for the Monday Night Football job (#McAfeeForMNF), a man scamming Facebook and Google for over 120 million dollars, Cardi B being in hot water for some comments she made about the way she treated patrons of her former strip club, The Pub boys starting their own scooter gang, and Nick, Ty, and Digs starting a Jeep gang. Pat also retells the hilarious story about Laron Landry's pet monkey, and Edgerrin James deciding that he didn't want to go to Tokyo for a preseason NFL game, plus much more. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy and closes with a timeless classic from Hootie and the Blowfish.

item.title: Ep. 56 - I Wanna Be Rich
item.description:
On today's episode, the guys dive deep into March Madness and discuss their bets and who's doing well and who's getting slaughtered. They also get into a lengthy conversation about the way toys have changed since Todd and Gorms were kids, and the guys have a few thoughts on jigsaw puzzles as well. Pat gives a rundown about his run-in with the NCAA his rookie year with the Colts and how they continually to be the most short-sighted corporation in the world. The guys also discuss Gorms budding rivalry with Singh, the gas station worker who works up the road from the boys and recently ABSOLUTELY BODIED Gorman over a $3.99 charge discrepancy, and lastly the guys all discuss their different morning routines on workdays, and how real Zito and heel Zito have very different rituals. As always, the guys each pick a song to help launch you into the weekend with some Friday Bangerz. It's a fun one, come and have a good time with us.


This episode features @toddmccomas, @PatMcAfeeShow, @Digz, @nickmaraldo, @tyschmit, @BostonConnr, @HeyGorman, @VivalaZito, and @evanfoxy
